Reviews.Title: “Impossibly nice staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer_D_B
Reviews.Content: My mother and I were visiting San Francisco this past November (2011) to see my brother who had recently relocated there. We picked the Grosvenor because of the reasonable pricing for a larger unit with a kitchenette. The room had a lovely view over downtown and we were able to put the kitchen to good use for a quiet family dinner one night; that alone made the short trip well worth it. The Grosvenor is located near Powell, and the adjacent cable car line. It’s close to both Chinatown and the Union Square areas, I would say it’s walking distance to plenty of great sights, but the San Francisco hills redefine walking distance in my humble opinion. All of those things were great, but what really prompted us to write a review of the hotel was their outstanding staff. We had arranged for Tony, a Grosvenor staff supervisor, to pick us up from the airport. He was friendly, professional and on time despite our flight being delayed. Everyone else at the hotel was just as thoughtful and professional going out of their way to accommodate minor requests like extra towels or a blanket, to major inconveniences like helping us track down my missing wallet (left it in a cab). Truthfully, I ended up feeling worse about the level of concern and effort they put into tracking down the wallet on my behalf, than I did for having lost the thing in the first place. After what seemed like a few hundred phone calls the wallet was located, thank you Ryan! I eventually got it back, cash and all, so we give Yellow Cab a thumbs up too. By the time we left I really did feel like I had stayed with friends, as cliche as that sounds. My mom and I do a fair amount of traveling individually and between the two of us we can honestly say we’ve never encountered a nicer group of people. My very sincere thanks again to Ryan, Victoria, Tony, Housekeeping and the rest of the Grosvenor staff, we hope to see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Spacious Pad near the top of Nobs Hill”
Reviews.Author: ReginaldSLin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 30 mar to 01 Apr 2012. I spent these two days in SF as a stopover on the way back from Vegas to home. Price wise, SF hotels were all a lot more expensive than in Vegas. So the tendency would have been to compare the luxury I got in Vegas for the price I got there, to what I was getting in SF. However that would be unfair. By SF standards, after scouring the web for good deals and well located hotels, I found Grosvenor Suites. Got a corner one-bedroom suite, and it was really nice and spacious. What some other reviewers call "worn-out" or "old", I call "has character" and "cosy". The suite certainly reminded me of decor you would find in a typical rich man's home in east asia in the '70s. Location was great, just 10-15 min walk to times square. 10 min to chinatown. Right next to the cable car that would take you to Fisherman Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfortable spacious accommodation & fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: RRidgwell
Reviews.Content: Really cant say enough good things about my stay here Sept 2011 Have just got round to writing a review as my grandson said I should as the room was exceptionally large clean comfortable & the view from our window was spectacular We found the kitchen very useful as we often woke well before breakfast & could therefore have a hot drink/light snack before we went down for breakfast I loved the location of the Grosvenor it was lovely & peaceful I highly recommend the Grosvenor I enjoyed my stay so much I have booked to return in May 2012

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: samjr_7
Reviews.Content: The suites were comfortable and totally adequate for the travellers needs. The breakfast was great and staff friendly and helpful. Nothing fancy, but clean and comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location. Friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Stephen S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at the Grosvenor Suites. The location and price were excellent. The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are large and have a small kitchen, which is very nice for a longer stay. All in all, very happy with the decision to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location but average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Undertraveled
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from the Mark Hopkins Hotel atop Nob Hill. Don't expect that this hotel is anywhere in the same league...you will be grossly disappointed. The rooms are dated but the kitchenette is updated and well equipped. The bathroom is tiny but a decent shower. The beds are okay but probably ready for replacing soon. We wanted to be within walking distance to Chinatown and we were. There are some steep hills on the way so be warned. The continental breakfast was good; bagels, cereal, pastries, fruit, and was located in a clean,sunny room. The parking garages threw us but then we arrived at 11:30PM in the rain so that might account for the confusion. Also, we came down Mason Street and the parking garages are on Pine so we had to make a series of left turns to get to the hotel. Lastly, we had checked out but wanted to leave our car there until we done in Chinatown. They said we could leave the car as long as we wanted. That was greatly appreciated. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: JeanyNOLA
Reviews.Content: Location A++ - This hotel could not be in a better neighborhood. It is a very close walk to Union Square, Chinatown, and the attractions of Nob Hill. It is even a manageable walk to Fisherman's Wharf and Ghirardelli Square. We also took a taxi back from this area and it only cost $10. Downside - some very steep hills, but great exercise, especially with a stroller! Staff A++ - The staff was very friendly, helpful and accommodating! The Room was also great - we had a top floor, 1 bedroom unit with a kitchen. It was very roomy with 2 full size beds in the bedroom and a full pull out bed in the living room. The view was incredible! Full, unobstructed views of the bay and Nob Hill. Downside - not very fancy, but very comfortable. The elevator was also a little noisy! Overall - an excellent choice in a great area of Nob Hill for a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Need more space try this hotel”
Reviews.Author: drosiewh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from Feb 3 through Feb 7,2011 with spouse and 2 teens. Arrived late in evening from the east coast so we were ready for bed. The suite was clean and the separate bedroom with 2 beds was just what we needed. Overall this hotel met our needs. While it does not have the amenities of the name brand hotels the location, clean rooms, free breakfast and very accommodating staff help to make the trip enjoyable. The price we paid for the value we received on Nob Hill in San Francisco was well worth it. Try this hotel if you need extra room, a fridge and a good location

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lawofkirk
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for families, rooms are a little worn, but very spacious. A tad noisy due to neighborhood, but overall great value and awesome if you have kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great Central location”
Reviews.Author: tezza B
Reviews.Content: Stayed late Aug 2011. Likes: Great location, good size rooms, wonderful complimentary breakfast. Complementary wi-fi throught hotel and also a computer kiosk. Would rate between average and very good but no 3.5 button. Average: Some reception staff more friendly (customer service orientated) than others. Reception area is small. Lacks a foyer area to sit and relax. Rooms/bathrooms showing a little age but very clean and comfortable. General: Paid approx $170-175 per night (including all taxes and booking fees) booking online (can be done done via various online accommaodation booking sites). All-in-All would stay again for location and value for money in central San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - good for the leg muscles!!”
Reviews.Author: Jozcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2011 for 3 nights, we'd looked at a lot of hotels online before we chose the Grosvenor and were encouraged by its location and room size for the price (based on the prices in San Francisco which are pretty expensive!!). Despite being told at the airport that it was too far to walk from the BART we managed it fine - up a big hill dragging our suitcases (yes, we had a rest a couple of times). Our room was great, good size, nice kitchenette and beds comfortable - it was nice to be able to open the window! All our questions were answered very helpfully at reception - though a smile was a little hard to find from one of the staff there.......a smile goes a long way! Breakfast room was a little small but you could take your breakfast back up to your room if you chose - we were happy with the breakfast. Best of all though was the location - near to the cable car stop and shopping and restaurants. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Workmanlike Accomodation in Frisco”
Reviews.Author: ajay04_10
Reviews.Content: Grosvenor Suites offers workmanlike accomodation in Frisco. We were two couples and had one each of a studio (higher floor) and a suite (first floor). Both units had well equipped kitchens, and both offered great extra space. As expected the property was comfortable without being luxurious. There is no lobby to speak of, and if you have to wait for any reason it can be a problem. The breakfast is served in a smallish ground floor room and offers basic choices as is customary of a continental spread. The location is indeed very useful... right between Union Square and the wharf, so you are equidistant from both. We walked to Union Square several times as its all downhill, but preferred a taxi coming back uphill ! As mentioned by other guests, the front office gentlemen are most helpful and courteous. Tony, Ryan and others, as also Khalid from the little office to the side, made things easier all through for us. To sum up, it is a great deal for budget conscious travellers, if you avoid overpaying and have booked at the right prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: AMc186605
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent 4 nights in Grosvenor suites and were looked after superbly.The kids were all acknowledged and we felt truly welcome.Special mention for Ryan on front of house reception whose customer service was truly exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in the City”
Reviews.Author: thrifty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas, visiting family. It was very relaxing. The rooms are nice, comfortable, clean and spacious. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. There is an amazing view from the higher floors. The kitchen is nice, although there's not a lot of kitchenware, but we didn't use it much anyway. The hotel breakfast room is small, but never really busy. You can take breakfast up to your room if you wish. The continental breakfast is ample for most purposes. Only one elevator was functioning whilst we were there, but it was very fast, so there was never a big wait time. There's a parking lot at the rear, which is expensive, but visitors can park temporarily, for pick-up or drop-off. The location is great, near to Union Square (and Powell Street station). It's the perfect spot in downtown and excellent value for money. We will probably stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great Tony at reception!”
Reviews.Author: barbara-lacoccinelle
Reviews.Content: My first stay in the City, and frankly perfect choice for a hotel: super practical localisation, comfortable room (great idea to include a fitted kitchen), fine bathroom, nice breakfast, stunning views: will return ! ..and then I got even luckier and was offered to move to a luxury suite (so I wouldn't be bothered by repairs to the room next to mine), and waow! I really want to mention Tony at reception who combines both professional skills and 'gentillesse' as we say in French: thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, great view”
Reviews.Author: Jerry H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property seven times in 10 years and it has always been consistent. San Francisco can be a really expensive city to visit and frankly the chain properties are often over priced and kind of bland. The Grosvenor does a very nice job of being an independant property and balancing the needs of it's guests with the reality that it is not a chain. The property is a suite-type-hotel with a kitchen, fridge microwave and stove. It is located near the top of Nob Hill. It is a block away from the Hayes Street cable car and a short walk to Union Square. The one thing to keep in mind is that this property does have some quirks and it can look a bit dated but for the rates it is well worth over looking those little things. As for the staff, the are OK but if you engage them they will step up and shine with great advice about local eateries. The breakfast is truly continental. If you are here for more than a night, slip the breakfast lady a tip. She can be surly otherwise :-) I can not stress this enough. You will not get a better view of the city for the price. That alone and the location are the strongest assets.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: Wildwoodatheart
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Grosvenor MANY times. As a family of 5, it is difficult to find affordable hotels with rooms and beds where we all fit. We return to the Grosvenor year after year because we have lots of space in their suites! The beds are hard, and not the most comfortable, but for us that's ok. They recently updated, and the rooms now have nice flat screen tvs with a mass of channels to choose from. Nice little kitchen in each suite; you could cook a full dinner. Bathrooms are a bit small but adequate. They serve a continental breakfast, which is a BIG money saver in SF. It's nothing special, but the coffee is good. One thing to know about this hotel, it is several blocks from Union Square, up a VERY steep hill. It could be tough walk if you're not in shape. However, it is only one block from the cable car on Powell Street. (If they are not already full from people getting on in Union Square.) This is an older hotel, so it doesn't have all the spa amenities, etc that the fancy hotels on Union Square have. It does have a "cool" international clientele, though, so you'll meet people from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotelrooms, with a full kitchen.”
Reviews.Author: BEEBEE4545
Reviews.Content: I love to stay at this older hotel in San Francisco. It is an older property, and not a 4 star hotel, but very clean and comfortable. Loads of hot water, with good pressure. They have a free, continental breakfast. The rooms are big, and there is a real, but small kitchen in the room, including coffee maker, pans, cutlery and dish soap. There are 4 grocers in the 2 block radius. We shop, then pack our own string bag snacks/ lunches while we see the city. (China town is a fast cable car ride away, and the food and fruits are wonderful, and CHEAP.) Often, when the kids are tired, we order in pizza,Asian, or Italian food, and have our own wine, soft drinks, and desserts out of our kitchen. It saves a fortune over a 9 day vacation. It saves a ton of time, while visiting the city. You can make yourself a full, hot breakfast/lunch/dinner, or store and reheat leftovers from area restaurants. We and make hot brownies and ice cream for an evening TV snack. There is a kitchen table, too, so the kids don't have to eat in bed. Bathrooms have great storage, and there are huge closets, so when you stay for a week, the rooms feel spacious and tidy. It is also on the cable car line, just walk to the corner. The hotel is quiet, and in a very safe area. The staff is very helpful, and the elevators are quick. The only possible downside? The rooms windows actually open , which I love, but it could be a problem if you have toddlers who like to climb.

Reviews.Title: “Large suite, good value & location”
Reviews.Author: runtom
Reviews.Content: Located 4 very steep blocks from Union Square, I thought Saturday night for $159 minus the AAA discount was a good value. Parking was rather expensive at $35 plus tax. The staff was not particularly helpful. The continental breakfast was a little disappointing with just pastries, bagels, cold cereal, bananas, apples, coffee, milk, and juice. We booked a two room Junior Suite with a queen bed, but were sent to a one room Studio Suite initially. We complained and were assigned another room without an apology or comment from the desk clerk. I believe we were given a Corner one Bedroom Suite because it contained a King bed. The suite was very large and comfortable. The bedroom could be separated from the living area by closing the doors. The bathroom could be accessed without entering the bedroom. The kitchenette was small but well equipped with a stove, microwave & large refrigerator, plus pots, pans, dishes, glasses and silverware. The furniture was comfortable, but worn and scuffed. It did not appear particularly clean. The free WiFi was adequate at 2.5Mbps. The only problem was regulating the temperature. Despite weather in the 50's, the room was uncomfortably warm when we entered. Opening the windows helped some, but there was no central unit to circulate the air. Upon check out we were informed that we could have requested a fan. We had a nice view from the 14th floor, but the traffic noise was bothersome if we left the window open to cool the room at night while trying to go to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Views”
Reviews.Author: Ullysees
Reviews.Content: View across San Francisco to the Bay. Wonderful room with quite adequate kithchenette facilities. Real Balconies. We had to have heating turned up which was done immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are worse than reviews would let on”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: Although the space of our suite was nice, there was no central AC when the sun baked our 17th floor room and the front desk seemed daunted by our requests for suitcase holders and clothes hangers, audibly sighing in disbelief over the room phone.

Reviews.Title: “What a delightful place!”
Reviews.Author: MTHSydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a hidden gem in Nob Hill only 5 minutes walk from Union Square. I spent 6 nights here in total on 2 separate occassions. Having arrived from my 20 hour journey I was advised I was upgraded to a corner king suite and it was sublime. The rooms are quite old fashioned but that is part of the charm. The dark wood and the old coil stove, there was even china on display in the china cabinet! The bathroom is small (1 person only standing room) but it has a bath and that is really important to me as I tend to walk everywhere when I am travelling so like to relax in the evening. When I came back for 3 days at the end of my trip I had a junior suite which has separate bedroom with queen bed and was perfectly fine but if you can its worth the extra $ for the corner room.This place is clean, spacious and has everything you need including the kitchen. I am so pleased that I booked my own accommodation using TA as a guide rather than ending up at the Hyatt where work would have sent me for twice the cost. Book via the hotel website as they have some good deals. The front desk staff are very welcoming, helpful and unassuming and Tony is a character who made my adventure to Stanford very easy. Highly recommend for solo traveller or family or business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, large suites, shows its age”
Reviews.Author: Tenn_Jedi
Reviews.Content: We had an 18th-floor corner suite with awesome views of downtown SF. The master king bed was fine, the fold out coach in the living room not very comfortable. The furniture, carpets, elevators, etc. show some wear and tear, and the kitchen was not well equipped but did have the basics. The hotel is clean and the staff friendly. No real amenities, though it does offer $15 gym passes and has a third-party company providing room service. Overall this is an excellent value for the price, all things considered. A block away from the Fairmont, so easy to hop a cab there, and a block away from the Powell Street cable cars with a stop. Nob Hill location is nice. For business or non-luxury travel, this is a very serviceable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: BuckLanders
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic trip around california, we booked the Grosvenor after much searching and obviously reading the reviews on here. We were on a tight budget so this hotel fitted well for us. Upon arrival the hotel staff we very helpful in getting our parking sorted and we checked in with no problems. I think as long as you remember what you are paying for this hotel then its just fine. The breakfast is actually pretty good, the room is small where it is served but you can take it up to your room. We ate there every morning and enjoyed it, coffee is good and you can have cereals, bagels, fruit and juice. As many others have said the location is great, easy walk down to Union Sq. obviously coming back up the hill is a bit more of a struggle for those unfit like me! But you can easily jump on a cable car. We only had the smallest room, the studio. You get a large bed, a table with 2 chairs, a sofa and a kitchenette with fridge, cooker, sink etc. The only thing I would say is that the interior of this hotel is dated and so are the rooms, everything is very old but considering what you are paying I think its fine. If it was top notch then the room rate would be massively higher! Only thing I would be aware of when staying here or any of the hotels in central SF is the cost of parking! Think it was about $30 plus per day, so adds up if you are there for a while. My advice would be to only have a car when you are doing day trips out of the city as you don't really need one for all the central stuff as the cable cars do the job well plus you get to take in the atmosphere. Last thing to say is I thought the staff at this hotel were great, and really helpful. would recommend for those on a budget

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: denygold
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in San Francisco as long as you understand what you are getting. It is not a five star, full service hotel, it is an older, remodeled apartment building. What you don't get are restaurants, bellboys, incredible decor etc etc. What you do get is a fantastic location, a great staff (everyone we have ever dealt with here is incredible) and a really fair price for Nob Hill. The rooms are large (bathrooms aren't though) and the views are unbelievable. Parking is convenient, but expensive. Be aware that the simplest way to get around is to walk- but you will either go straight up (one block to California St cable car line) or straight down (a few blocks to Union Square)- you get plenty of exercise. The breakfast room is limited to bagels, cereal and rolls- but it is enough to get you started for the day. The bottom line is that, even though the Grosvenor has some caveats- we love this place !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Union Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: whitemlf
Reviews.Content: It was a little farther away from the hustle and bustle of Union Square, actually more on the outskirts of Union Square towards Nob Hill. The street was fairly quiet and a block away from the California Streetcar as well as the Powell Line. We were given a free upgrade upon check-in, always a plus, and received wonderful service throughout our visit. The hotel is a bit old, but still in good shape. The breakfast was continental as advertised, but there was quite a bit of variety, although very little protein. The only complaint was that though the weather was very mild, they had already turned the heat on and the building only has central heat, so we slept with the windows open.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, inexpensive and really great”
Reviews.Author: david24126
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grosvenor Suites for six nights from 27 October 2011. The location is 3 blocks from Union Square and 50 yards from the Powell Street cable car. Our apartment was very spacious and clean and the staff were efficient and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not great rooms”
Reviews.Author: djs50
Reviews.Content: No air conditioning and it was 90 degrees. Shower really bad. Close to city activities I think cities overcharge for hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lucaerrante
Reviews.Content: Nice location up Nob Hill, good hotel with large rooms (suites, actually) and mini kitchen: nothing fancy, but spacious, clean and efficient. View from 14th floor excellent. There's a parking lot, but expensive, especially compared to the room rate, which is a steal in San Francisco. Complimentary breakfast and free wifi. Would absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “FULL MARKS”
Reviews.Author: 19-DIARMUID_51
Reviews.Content: If you want a comforatable, clean, affordable hotel with the friendliest staff in one of the best areas of SF, look no further than the Grosvenor Suites. Stayed here for two weeks in September and it was a pleasure. All staff, but especially Tony and Ryan at front desk, were really helpful. Housekeeping excellent. Wi fi superb. PC and printer free in lobby. Good area for public transport. They provide car to and from airport at a good price. Oh and all this comes with a great breakfast with a good variety of really fresh foods, Unlike most hotels the coffee is good too. No hesitaton in recommending this hotel and we hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: OccasionalCruiser
Reviews.Content: There were good & bad things about this hotel. The price was good, much cheaper than the places we'd been staying on previous visits to San Francisco, but the place was a bit worn around the edges, though clean. Since it's a suite, there's plenty of room, but the bedroom area is a bit small for a king size bed; there was only a foot or two to get around it, which was difficult at night. The carpet in the living room had small holes in places. We didn't use the kitchen, but it was nice to have. The bathroom was tiny but had good lighting. The towels and bed linens were very tacky, poor quality. The pillows were like big rocks which I found almost impossible to use comfortably. There was no temperature control in the room, other than the window. We had a room on the same floor as the breakfast room, so it was a good thing we were getting up early anyway. The continental breakfast was decent, especially since it's rare in the city to have one included in the price of the room. Free internet and a nice flat screen TV in the living room were also a plus (though we didn't watch TV). We were shocked that there were quite a few steep stairs to get to the tiny lobby and then some more stairs to get to the level where the elevator was (and where our room was). When we mentioned the Americans with Disabilities Act requirements, they said there was an elevator up from street level. I guess it was around the corner on the ramp to the parking lot, but you really had to know about it in advance. That still wouldn't have gotten you to the lobby without stairs. We just took the stairs, but it was annoying when we had luggage. If you plan to use public transportation, which we did, be aware that this hotel is on Nob Hill. We walked from the Powell Street muni station. The hotel is way uphill from there (probably 8 blocks or so); the last 2 blocks are almost vertical. For old legs like ours, going downhill toward the station may even have been harder than uphill. We didn't see a bus that we could transfer to that came anywhere near it, but I suppose there might have been. Of course, the cable car does go straight up Powell (about a block from the hotel), but that's $5 a ride which seems excessive. (The cable car is something you should do once, just to say you have, but otherwise it's way overpriced.) In summary, I wasn't offended by the place, but not in love with it either. I'm not sure I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Marie-Rose A
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at 10:30AM, instead of telling us that we are early, we were welcomed & given a nicer one bedroom suite # 1511. Walking distance from China Town (interesting experience), Union Square, & the Bart (SFO metro to the airport). The only thing this hotel needs is new carpet. I asked Morten at the front desk for some directions & hoe much it would cost to use the cable car, the provided me with a pass that another guest gave them to pass along. After my visit, I left the pass which I am sure, they gave to another guest. Morten made this a wonderful trip to remember. Thank you Morten, Eric H

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: simbasmum
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on 30th August, having called in the morning from Las Vegas to check our arrival and been offered a car to collect us from the airport - at $45 this was a good deal for 4 of us, and we really appreciated it, thanks Tony! We had room 1308, right by the elevator, it was a good size room but I had really hoped we might have got a corner suite, which I think would have given us better views and a bit more room, but all in all it was fine. The kitchenette was wonderful, we collected our breakfast each morning and took it to our room, we really appreciated the breakfast, which is a nice bonus. Room was clean and everything worked fine, bathroom a little small but perfectly fine. There are two best things about this place, one is the location, which is just ideal for walking anywhere, and for public transport. We walked down Powell to Fishermans Wharf, dead easy, about 15 minutes. About 5 minutes down the hill to Union Square for shopping. Good places to eat nearby - we ate at Uncle Vito's one night (had to wait 40 minutes for a table but well worth it for some good filling pasta and a great atmosphere) and at Lori's Diner one night, a great all American experience! the other good thing is the staff - Ryan and Devin on the front desk were just great, always ready for a chat and with advice on where to eat, where to shop etc. So, it served us really well being a family of 4, good value for money and comfortable too!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, a bargain (especially if you don't spend time in your room)”
Reviews.Author: Rose U
Reviews.Content: A great bargain but be prepared for a drafty room, a shower with hot/cold water every five seconds. Be prepared to hear complaints from guests when you are in the computer room which is connected to the hotel lobby (very small so easy to hear). Plumbing seemed to be the majority of complaints. I would strongly caution folks not to use the hotel guest computers as my account was hacked and I spent my first day home cleaning up after that mess. I notified the hotel and requested one night's restitution for my troubles. Received a letter today declaring their computers were not at fault and offering me a free night out of my next three day stay. Sorry but will not be staying there again. I met the icons of San Francisco - Marian and Vivian Brown in the computer/mail room (they live in the hotel) which was a wonderful treat. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marian_and_Vivian_Brown Other than meeting the Brown twins, it was an abysmal experience and not worth repeating. Having said that, if you are looking for a bargain, this one's for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in SF”
Reviews.Author: Kristal57
Reviews.Content: Nice place with large rooms and mini kitchen. The 2 walk in closets made it seem even larger as no tripping over luggage. Room right by elevator but surprisingly quiet. Parking expensive like all of SF, but convenient and easily car accessible. Kitchen and complimentary breakfast a great addition. Nothing fancy but clean and comfy and convenient. Would recommend and also visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Shobha49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grosvenor Suites from 27th June to 29th June 2011. The check in was simple and quick. The room itself was spacious and well equipped. There was a kitchenette and all the necessary utensils. There was wi-fi and complimentary breakfast that was served daily.The breakfast was quite adequate. The staff was ever-smiling and accomodating. The only drawback was the steep climb to the hotel while returning from Union square which is located at a short distance. Still I would definitely stay again at Grosvenor suites if I visit San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in San Francisco, CA”
Reviews.Author: jb2257
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grosvenor Suites recently. The staff and service provided by Tony and Khalid at the front desk was excellent. The suites were quite large for San Franciso standards, were very clean and had everything that you could need or want including a small kitchen, coffee maker, plates, silverware, and glasses. They had a continental breakfast each morning with a very nice selection of pastries, coffee, cereal and juices. This was a great location within walking distance of the Mark Hopkins Hotel, Chinatown and Union Square. My only suggestion would be to upgrade the TV to HD, and change the beds and linens to the hotel type, but for the price and location you can't beat it. We will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!! You would be hard pressed to get such a good location at a keener price. Not cheap, but worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Cream_Crackered_Dad
Reviews.Content: Our requirements were simple; to find accommodation for our family of 5 in San Francisco at a location within walking distance of cable cars and close to a good selection of restaurants - without paying the earth! Grosvenor Suites met these requirements fully. A two room suite meant we didn't have to pay for two hotel rooms (much more expensive). The suite was comfortable without being luxurious. Parking was $25 per day plus tax (pretty standard for SFR). Complimentary breakfast was very good offering pastries, juice and coffee. Demand for this meant the dining room was a little cramped at peak times but easy to grab a bite to take back to your suite. Would particularly recommend for families of 5 or 6.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: amapolasaenz
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect! Space of apartment is wonderful especially travelling with teenagers, has a sofa bed in the spacious living room, kitchen, wonderful views and includes breakfast!!! We had a corner apartment with a balcony, daily cleaning and change of towels. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, outstanding location and good value”
Reviews.Author: travel43_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in August. We were very pleased with everything about this hotel. The room was clean and VERY spacious. We had a kitchenette, a living/dining area and a separate bedroom with 2 queen beds. The kitchenette was well equipped so that we could save some money on food by cooking in 2 nights. There was a huge closet in the hallway (yes, it was so big that it had a small hallway) and 2 smaller closets in the bedroom. There were 2 tvs and free wi-fi. As a result of Hurricane Irene, we were "stranded" in San Francisco and unexpectantly needed to stay an extra 3 days/2 nights. The staff were so kind and accommodating. They even searched on their own to see if they could help us to get home faster! Tony at the front desk was particularly helpful and helped set up a ride to the airport (again!) through the hotel for $45. All of the staff helped with directions and recommendations. I have to say that I disagree with another poster about the noise level. We heard absolutely nothing from any of the other rooms. In fact, my husband and I commented that we thought this was the quietest hotel we had ever been in. It was as if we were home in our own single family house! The breakfast was good - a nice selection of different flavor bagels, pastries and cereals. We thought that the location was great - and we got a lot of exercise walking up and down the hills nearby. The views from the windows were nice and we loved having windows that opened so that we could get some fresh air. We never really waited too long for an elevator. The coin operated laundry was helpful when my daughter spilled Ghiradelli hot fudge all over her only pair of pants. And, there were about 7 washers/dryers, not just one. The hotel was a good value for everything provided (very spacious rooms, breakfast, wi-fi) Overall, we had a great experience at the Grosvenor Suites. We would definitely stay there again and would happily recommend it to any friends/family visiting SF.

Reviews.Title: “Short nice visit.”
Reviews.Author: Lovejones69
Reviews.Content: We did an overnight stay, my husband, son and I. There was a mix up on our room and we ended up walking in on someone else. We have stayed here previously and this was the first time something like that happened. The elevators are a tad slow. The rooms were nice and clean. The location is great and it's close to lots of things. We will stay again for sure. The breakfast was okay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value,location and size”
Reviews.Author: 9jane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August.Only 4 blocks from Union square.V large appt with 2 big beds and a comfortable sofa bed so our family of 4 were all happy.It had a good kitchen with both cooker and microwave. A complimentary breakfast is included and we thought it had a very good selection of pastries, bagels and muffins. As the breakfast room is small it is fine to tke it back to your own room to eat. The reception staff were v helpful and went out of their way to provide us with maps and directions. Devin at front desk deserves a special mention. Grosvenor Suites is not the most luxurious place but it is clean,friendly ,has a good location and we would definitely stay there again when in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, huge room, breakfast, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Denise049
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (2 kids 11 and 16) stayed at Grosvenor Suites for a week in August 2011. We had room 1703 - a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds, a pull out couch in the living room, kitchen and dining table. We had two TV's and the hotel has free WIFI. Also there is a coin operated washer/dryer in the hotel. The room had super views on 2 sides and windows that actually open - we could see the ocean from our room. I didn't realize when I booked that there was breakfast every morning (cereal, bagels pastries, fruit) which helped to cut down on restaurant meals. The kitchen was great for keeping some snacks for the kids and heating up leftovers. The best thing about this hotel is the size of the room, the location and the price. It is a short downhill walk to Union Square and Westhill Mall. One block to Cable Cars. We walked to Union Square and the mall several times to shop. Once we caught the F train to Fisherman's Wharf and another time we took a city bus from Union Square to Golden Gate Park. The hotel is located only a few blocks from Chinatown. The only downside to the hotel is that there isn't a pool which I think is quite common in San Fransisco. Also - the rooms are dated, so if you really need the hotel to be modern with all of the newest furniture, granite countertops then this place isn't for you. The hotel was clean, comfortable and was reasonably priced. The staff were super helpful by giving directions and booking us a cab to the airport (45.00 from hotel to airport).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn-London-UK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, good location and value for money was excellent. We had a suite that included a fridge and cooker so great if you had a family. Our room was on the 10th Floor so we had a really good view of the city. Easy walking distance to all the attractions. Our rate also included a continental breakfast. Great Value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Value Value Value”
Reviews.Author: SteveinActon
Reviews.Content: Spent several days in a family suite. Rooms were clean and comfortable. I researched a long time and i do not think there is better vlaue for the dollar. Great location up on Nob's Hill. Staff pleasant - walking distance to Union Sq and just off the Cable Cars

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Rose F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grosvenor Suites with 3 girlfriends in July for 3 days. One reason I chose this hotel was that it was one of the few in San Francisco that offered 2 queen beds (who knew!), in a good location for a reasonable price. As many other reviewers have stated, we weren't sure what to expect based on previous reviewers experiences. We arrived very late at night and found the young man at the front desk to be very pleasant and accommodating, even offering to help us carry our luggage and providing extra towels upon request. We were pleasantly surprised to find that our 12th floor room, while rather dated looking, was very clean and spacious, with ample room for our considerable luggage. The room had a dining table, a small sitting area and a kitchenette with a stove and fridge. We had a decent view of the city skyline, which was nice when it was not shrouded in fog. Beds are a bit uncomfortable, but not a huge deal. My only real complaint was that the walls are a bit on the thin side and we could hear the kids in the neighbouring room screaming and running around. Those guests who are not light sleepers should not find this a problem. The complimentary breakfast, while not deluxe, was fine. Bagels, toast, cereal and pastries, as well as bananas and apples were available. Coffee, tea and a variety of juices were also on hand. The room that the breakfast is served in is VERY tiny, with about 8 small tables, so it was very crowded each morning. Most people seemed to take their food and go back to their rooms. Again, this worked for our purposes and kept us going until noon. The ladies who served breakfast were quite friendly, although seemed a bit overwhelmed by the volume of guests bombarding them each morning. I would probably be as well! The Nob Hill location made an excellent base for exploring San Francisco. We loved being able to walk everywhere or hop on the Powell Street trolley (1/2 block away). One tip to future guests-unless you take the trolley early in the morning, you may not be able to get on it due to heavy volumes of people. However, it is only a 10-15 minute walk to Union Square, and a 25-30 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf. Walking to the Wharf takes you through Chinatown, which offers scenic views of the Bay Bridge. We found the area to be very safe at all times of the day, and were happy to find several convenience stores and a Walgreen's only blocks away for any last minute items needed. Parking in the underground garage was an additional $35 a day, on par with other San Fran hotels. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay at the Grosvenor Suites and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VACATION”
Reviews.Author: VenitaS
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grosvenor Suites july 6th 2011 thru July 10th 2011 We had a Great Room .Plenty of light though the windows and drapes to shut at night so you could Sleep well. It was very roomy for 3 of us the room was quite and the breakfast was great.We even had a kitchen.We was at the top of the Nob Hill very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Charged twice for my stay”
Reviews.Author: RippedoffAdelaide
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights. On second day paid for the seven night stay together with $75 deposit for safe key. On booking out hotel believed we had not paid. Produced receipt and after numerous entries made on the computer over about 20 minutes believed matter sorted out. Later discovered I was charged again for room together with key deposit on credit card. Hotel contacted and I was advised they had reversed the incorrect transactions. Hotel twice advised me the matter had been fixed by refunding my credit card. Matter only finally fixed after Visa reversed the transaction nearly three months later. I was not impressed by the double charge and in particular the hotel telling me lies as to refunding the over charge. The original key deposit was never refunded. I would not recommend this hotel after this experience.,

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: kmohawk
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find affordable accommodations in the heart of SF, especially for a large group, so this hotel was a good fit. The five of us shared a deluxe suite, which includes two queen beds in the bedroom and a full pullout sofa in the living room. The location, near Nob Hill and within walking distance of Chinatown, Union Square and other sites was great. Overnight parking is expensive ($30+) so you might want to consider a nearby garage to shave off a few bucks. We had a lot of luggage so the hotel garage was a nice convenience (and a good size, not cavernous or tiny). The rooms are clean but far from luxurious. The little kitchen was also very nice and included some basics like dishwashing soap, utensils, etc. We had a great view from our room of San Fran as well. Two complaints: 1)the complimentary breakfast is horrible --- the food is old and the selection grim and 2)the front desk person (Devin) came off as haughty and disdainful. The hotel met my expectations but I think we'll try another place when we go back to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, stunning views from 19th floor suites”
Reviews.Author: ceriajay
Reviews.Content: We booked the Grosvenor Suites after a recommendation from a SF local hotelier - great advice! We had the top floor corner suite with a balcony to seat two easily. The views in late afternoon and at night were stunning. The suite was very spacious, decor a little tired but the whole hotel is to be refurbished we understand. Only downside was the small bathroom. The hotel is excellently situated just at both the California and the Powell trolley lines. Vito's pizza one block down the hill is a must - also to see the legendary Nob Hill twins in their leopardskin stetsons. The best part of our stay was the friendliness and professionalism of the front desk staff - Devin and Tony deserve a special mention for going out of their way during our stay - how refreshing to see such genuine helpfulness in a big city hotel. We would recommend this to anyone who wants "top of Nob Hill views" at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Most gorgeous view ever”
Reviews.Author: Emerald818
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the king corner suite on the 19th (top) floor. Our room was perfect for four of us (2 adults and 2 teenagers) the kitchen had everything we needed, the decor was pretty but the best part was the view from the balcony, especially at night. The hotel was close to the cable car and a short walk to Chinatown; lots of stores and eating close by as well. Staff was helpful -breakfast ok, enough to eat a bit and then go on your way. Would recommend the king corner suite if its available.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Lodging on Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: Okra876
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while I attended a conference held at the Hilton in Union Square. The rooms at the Hilton were over $250 per night with the conference rate. That was above my per diem, so we gave this place a try. We were charged $125.00 a night for a huge rooom with a private bathroom, balcony overlooking the city, king size bed, full kitchen, and small dining area. The customer service was great. Everyone we encountered was very friendly. They had a complimentary breakfast each morning that included fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, etc. The location was excellent. Right in the middle of Nob Hill which is more like an upper-class residential neighborhood, so everything was quiet and peaceful while still being steps from the action. We could walk everywhere (including Union Square). It is on top of a very steep hill, but everything in San Francisco is. There is a transit stop beside the hotel if you can't or don't want to tackle the hill. Overall, excellent stay. If we are ever back in the San Francisco area we will for sure stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: WorldWalkers1987
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the corner of Mason and Pine in the Knob Hill area of San Francisco. The rooms are clean although the carpet and paint are a bit dated, and in our room, there was some exposed wiring in the bedroom. Positives: Excellent location for getting around--just a few blocks from the Powell and California cable car lines, and within walking distance of Union Square and Chinatown. The staff is eager to help, courteous, and quite friendly, and a continental breakfast is offered each morning. The rooms have full-sized refrigerators, stoves, ovens, sink, a small countertop, simple cooking and eating utensils--quite sufficient for fixing breakfast or simple dinners. There are two convenience stores and a full grocery store nearby. The room rates are very competitive for the San Francisco area, and the corner King suites are very roomy. Negatives: The rooms are in need of some updating. The shower temperature fluctuated somewhat, which resulted in occasionally shockingly cold spurts of water while showering. Suggestions: Bring or purchase paper towels, napkins, foil to help with food preparation. We recommend the corner King suites for families--very roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a San Fran trip”
Reviews.Author: helen_stu74
Reviews.Content: We started our America roadtrip with 3 nights at the Grosvenor Suites. Had a great view out over the city from our balcony and the room itself was clean and comfortable if a bit dated.The free breakfast was a bonus. Location is good though it's a steep walk up Powell. We found the cable cars were fun but not the quickest way to get around. Staff were friendly and helpful and all in all we enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “We found it very convenient and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Kayjay64
Reviews.Content: Having read lots of reviews about this hotel I was a little reluctant to stay there. However after much thought, as my husband and I like space to move around when we are staying in a place for a week, we booked with trepidation. We were pleasantly surprised by the efficient welcome at reception and even more so when we entered our suite. It was spacious, the queen bed firm but comfortable and generally it ticked all the boxes. I'm not saying that this is a sumptuous place, far from it but it was comfortable and very convenient, safe and central. We liked it so much we stayed there again for a night on the way home. I'm a fairly fussy person to please, and this did!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ScarfaceSG
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located in downtown just few blocks away from Powell Street. Numerous restuarents, cafes and Chinatown all within 10 mins walking distance. Wonderful view of the city and the mountains from the rooms. You can even walk to Union Square and Bart stations. The rooms are quite big enough and have a small kitchenette which has a full size refrigerator and a microwave oven. The bathrooms are on a smaller side but not inconvientent by any way. A large wardrobe with a locker is also there in the rooms. The breakfast is included and is ok with not much variety. The staff at the reception are veru courteous and helpful. Few of them can converse in many different languages.

Reviews.Title: “newly renovated rooms await”
Reviews.Author: view-with-a-room
Reviews.Content: Yes the newly renovated rooms await your arrival. Fourth stay in a year and room 1103 is newly renovated. The electronics, bath, kitchen, floor coverings and wall coverings are new. The layout remains that of an apartment and the wonderful large windows remain. The heat is via the baseboard and he cool is via the windows! The area is quite nice for San Francisco. And do book on the hotel website as the corner rooms are the better views! And yes the hotel is on a very steep hill. The challenge of the hills in San Francisco is one of the highlights of every visit. Any luggage whatsoever is best addressed via a taxi, though. $35 a day for in/out parking in a secure lot is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: Nursingismybag
Reviews.Content: Very happy with Grosvenor Suites. We had a 1 bedroom suite with 2 queen size beds, very comfy for 3 people. The living room with a pull out sofa was large with big windows so we had a great view of the city. There was a small full kitchen with a table and chairs, plenty of closets and an in room safe. Our only issue was there was only 1 small bathroom. We could have used another half bath. The complementary continental breakfast was adequate but the breakfast room was small.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to visit the city but rooms are very dated.”
Reviews.Author: Jay9978
Reviews.Content: Tony one of the guys working at the hotel is the only bright spot for this hotel. I stayed in a suite with a mini kitchen and found the room to be very dated. Small tube tv in room, small bathroom, decor from the 60's. Water pressure and temperature changed continuously in the shower and the showerhead was located chest high. There are better places to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay...”
Reviews.Author: watermelon3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a corner king suite on the 17th floor, and the view was magnificent! The room was spacious, had a king bed in a separate room, and a sofabed. There were two flat panel tvs- one in the living room and one in the bedroom. It's not luxurious, but the space and the view made up for it, and everything was clean. Checkin and checkout were a breeze. Parking was $35 in a garage that had plenty of spaces. We drove a full size SUV and parking was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SMT68
Reviews.Content: Located a few blocks from Union Square is was perfectly situated for visiting the city. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and a continental breakfast included in the very reasonable price. Rooms were very clean but somewhat dated. Computers were available for those without a laptop/ tablet. I would definitely return for location/ price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locoation - Nice price”
Reviews.Author: Bits8
Reviews.Content: This place was perfectly located for what we were hoping to do in San Francisco. One block to the cable car, allowing quick access to the Fisherman's Wharf or to Union Square. Union Square was only a 10 minute walk away. Our double room was spacious enough for the four of us, with lots of place to stash our things. The free breakfast was very good, with fresh baked goods, cereal, some fruit and juices and coffee. While the breakfast room was small, the kitchenette in our room allowed us to eat there if needed. The staff was very helpful with setting up the various tours we took. At the price we paid, I can't complain about anything.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful staff, rooms adequate”
Reviews.Author: cao1530
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my spouse and young daughter for 6 nights. Loved the ease of transportation to the hotel via cable car down the block. Felt very safe walking all around the neighborhood. Staff welcoming and helpful. Printer availablilty perfect when booking last-minute tours. Nice to have free internet access, although it did shut down on stormy nights. Happy to have kitchen in room, but not so happy the floorplans on website not accurate- expected a bigger space so would have a place to put crib. Nice to have a crib supplied that was sturdy, not just a pack and play model. Happy with breakfasts- nice to have a variety of bagels/muffins/scones/croissants plus healthy cereals and fruit options. No doubt- would return to this hotel, especially with this great price!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous value and location”
Reviews.Author: H199
Reviews.Content: Super price, with continental breakfast. We used the cable car to reach our hotel daily. It is less than one block away and connected with a public transportation hub. Cable cars run every 5 minutes at this spot and with a MUNI passport it was great value. We stayed 7 nights at the hotel. The rooms were very clean, and the housekeeping staff were very pleasant and courteous. All the staff were gracious. There are 2 computers with a printer for guests to use. There are some permanent residents in this former apartment building and we had a great time chatting with two very elderly sisters. The hotel is a European style atmosphere and we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel that is an excellent value in a superb location.”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingTraveler77
Reviews.Content: There are pluses and minuses with this hotel. The pluses far outweigh the minues, but here's what you should know. There were 5 people in my group, so I booked a junior suite. There is a loading zone parking spot right in front of the hotel that is convenient for checking in. The reception staff is professional and helpful. The suite was spacious and adequately appointed. Plenty of space for the 5 of us. Full kitchenette - appliances are from the 1970's, but work just fine. WiFi is free and worked well. Terrific view of the city and bay. 5 minute walk to Chinatown. 10 minute walk to Union Square and the Powell-Market cablecar turnaround and Bart, a bit too far to walk if you have luggage. Bathroom is tiny, but has plenty of shelf space and everything is reasonably modern and in working order. The water temperature in the shower fluctuates cold-to-hot and back by a few degrees every 5 seconds or so, which is a little annoying but still tolerable. There is no thermastat in the room, so you have no control over the temperature. In the winter, the temperature was several degrees cooler than I prefer. The halls are even colder than that. This did not bother me, but could be an issue for some people. This is not a backpacker hotel. The clientele appear to be mostly middle class tourists. Breakfast is a good selection of pastries, bagels, cereals, fruit and juices. For me, this hotel was perfectly adequate and was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: lfeagle1
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for value, conveinence and great service, this is the place. It is located on Nob Hill, and is easily accessible from the Powell-Mason cable line. It is just a few blocks from Market and Powell which seems to be the hub of transportation. The rooms were spacious and clean but nothing fancy. The staff was more than helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and if we return to the area, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , very homely and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: scomal
Reviews.Content: Really loved our stay here at the Grosvenor. Apart from the hills, which you cannot escape in SF. We found the location to union square,the cable cars and all the sights very handy. Your own kitchen if you choose to eat in. The breakfast was plain. But being free was a great start to the day. People have complained that this place is outdated. yes it is. But thats what makes it unique and gives it a great homely feel. Would stay here again and recommend to anyone. Staff were all helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: christie135
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grosvenor Suites in San Francisco for a week. The hotel is at a great location, but the rooms could be better. It wasn't bad, but the furniture was quite old, a renovation would be nice. Otherwise it was okay, was nice to have a kitchenette. The breakfast was quite poor without a wide selection of choices, but still okay. We found this hotel a bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Sim038
Reviews.Content: Location was central to Trams and the City. Felt safe in this area. Reasonable view from the room. The room itself - well it is old, very old. The TV was also very old... A lot of people have commented on the breakfasts, yes it is in a makeshift motel room on the ground floor. We stayed for three nights and never had an opportunity to sit in there as there were only three tables. Taking a tray up to your room is the norm here. Reception staff were friendly and obliging. There are coined washing machines and driers in the basement (which I would recommend not using at night if you are a single female - kind of a scary feeling in the basement). We spoke to a gentleman who lived in the Motel for 37 years!! Wow, he made our trip to SF special - paying the same rent all this time!

Reviews.Title: “Super helpful staff in a very good location.”
Reviews.Author: konstanze454
Reviews.Content: Booked in here after reading mainly positive reviews of the hotel and was impressed. The reception staff were very helpful with local info and routes/transport ideas. This was backed up with a small area next to the internet terminals in the lobby which held travel brochures and booklets for days out. Anyone that that says this is a terrible hotel should do a bit more travelling to gain some perspective on the age old formula of service/location/rooms and price. The Grosvenor Suites scores fairly well on most points for us and very high for service. At checkout the staff overheard that we needed to get to Emeryville (about half an hour away) and one of them volunteered to take us in his own car. Top service we reckon. Yes the rooms are a tad old fashioned, but ours was clean and very spacious with separate lounge and a small kitchenette area. See the attached pics for a better idea of the place. Breakfast was good and the staff were making the most of the room available. Some folk (including ourselves) took the food back up to our room to give others a bit more space. The hotel was the best location to catch a trolley down to the sea front, only about half a block to the nearest trolley stop. Also close by were two delis, one to the left and the other to the right out of the hotel entrance. Both did excellent sandwiches for you night time munchies. A little further afield was Chinatown and Union Square, both about a 15 minute walk if you amble along gawking at the sights. Take a look at our travel map, we joined TA late in life and only review the places we have been since then. But, you can see that there is a good chance we know a decent hotel when we stay in one. The Grosvenor Suites is somewhere that we will definitely recommend to the discerning, budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for our family and in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Eve060
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here at the end of our 2 month world trip and we all felt very comfortable at this hotel. Yes - I agree with previous reviewers that the rooms are alittle tired and dated but it is clean,comfortable,reasonably priced and in a great location. Yes - it is on a hill but so is San Francisco!! The staff upgraded our room which was good but as we were on the 3 rd floor - the view wasn't as spectactular as further up. Breakfast's were very filling but service a bit inferior. However this proved to be an endless source of amusement to my teenage lads every morning so we saw the funny side of it!! Do the cycle trip around the Bay - it is really worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, definitely not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: happymokwf
Reviews.Content: We were there for 5 days in December. 2 days without heater and 1 day without water, is actually worst than a back packers joint. Location is near Union Square and Chinatown but the slope to reach the hotel will tired you out, especially if you are carrying shopping bags. Some of the service staffs are really nice but does not make you feel comfortable at all. One word, TERRIBLE.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Colin2109
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at grosvenor. It is in great location, one block away from two different cable car lines. Also a couple of blocks away from union square and lots of shopping. Hotel is getting a bit tied, but it was clean and comfortable. Staff were quick to respond. Breakfast was good and enough choice for continental breakfast. TIP - but yourself a MUNI pass to ride The cable cars. Three day pass $20 and you can buy but at walgreen's on power street near grosvenor

Reviews.Title: “A safe and pleasant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: agatharaisin
Reviews.Content: Not really a luxury hotel but very clean, comfortable and the well equiped kitchen made it very convenient to keep drinks and snacks handy. The bed was extremely comfortable. The free breakfast was more than enough to keep us going until lunchtime. Lots of fruit and coffee and juices. Cereals and various pastries. High on a hill all the rooms have really good views of the city and are free from street noise. Staff very pleasant and helpful. A perfect place to stay and do some siteseeing as it is close to all the main tourist spots.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, comfortable bit like your favorite sneakers”
Reviews.Author: Crowley59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with Terri (Wife) on a our quick RTW trip. We were only ini SFO for three days. Place was terrific value for money. Very large suite/apartment with two double beds, kitchenette, kitchen table, sofa etc and en suite. After terrible crowded hotel in Toronto(Bond Place Hotel) this was a welcome blessing. Bit old and tired though still very comfortable. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Daily Continental not the greatest but better than nothing. We walked up to the hotel a couple of time from Downtown and Finance District and it can be a challenge. Hills in SFO are steep. Plus is Cable Cars are only one block from Hotel so no need to walk unless you want too. We will be coming back again after we relocated to Denver and ready for our next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit outdated but clean and comfy. Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: April0222
Reviews.Content: I would stay again. Comfy clean beds and nice employees. Good size room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and customer service”
Reviews.Author: sherryvr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very clean, and the suites are spacious with two queen beds, sofa (not sofabed), and full kitchen. Hotel has no air conditioning, but the windows open, which was enough for us most of the nights. Many of the hotels in the area have no air conditioning. The location is great for cable car access, right at the corner, which goes to Fishermans Wharf, Chinatown, and other destinations. There are restaurants in the immediate walking area, as well as a Walgreens for incidentals. People at the small front desk are very friendly and accommodating, happily giving directions and information on things to do. Hotel has no restaurant, but offers a continental breakfast of coffee, juices, cereal, muffins, and bagels, which is very nice and fulfilling to start the day. They even cut the bagels for you! I found my laptop internet access excellent in our room, as well as the room off the front desk, where I printed our boarding passes (free use and printer for guests). There is a storage room for luggage if you arrive early or have a late flight; we arrived early and they happily had our room ready for us to check in, and we had a late flight and they stored our luggage for us. We used Grayline for our airport transfers, which were the least expensive with AAA. Parking is pricey at all SFO hotels, and a car is not needed since there are so many things to see in the immediate area to keep you busy for a 5 to 7 day vacation. We ate at the Empress Palace in Chinatown which was excellent, and also at the Chinatown Retaurant, which was just OK. Check out the restaurant.com website for good restaurant deals whenever you travel; you can get $25 certificates for a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: Mickqp
Reviews.Content: We were in SF for the first time (Sept 2010) and stayed at the Grosvenor suites through recommendations from Trip Advisor. The staff were friendly and helpful while the rooms were clean and well serviced. Although the hotel probably needs another renovation, it was one of the better value for money hotels that we could fine close to Union Square. It's conveniently close to the Powell & California cable car lines. It is also within walking distance to China Town. The hotel also provides a free continental breakfast in a small room on the ground floor. Free internet was also included as well as coin operated laundry facilities in the basement. The only downside was that the hotel was half way up the hill, so it can take a bit of effort walking back to it from Union Square. (Best advice is to take the cable car - you should get a SF Muni pass, which lets you gives you unlimited trips on the cable cars and most buses around SF). Overall the stay was enjoyable and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to stay in SF but doesn't want to spend $3-400/night on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for san francisco but breakfast.....”
Reviews.Author: ermione81
Reviews.Content: The only complain about this hotel its for the breakfast and the breakfast room. food is low quality, not so great choice, served by underpaid chinese waitrees in a terrible room with no place to move around and terrible view on a parking lot. take your stuff and eat in your room! excellent position though. close to chinatown and to market street. one day we went back to the hotel from fishermens wharf on foot. long but feasible if you're willing to walk! :D we booked it on an offer on booking.com otherwise prices are a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “would love to come back with more family. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: midwestTulsa
Reviews.Content: Checked in early. Room wasn't ready, but staff took care of luggage and off we went. Much to our suprise the room was huge, AND clean. NO BED BUGS! If we needed anything all we did was ask. They has the answers to everything these tourists asked. So close to everything. Ya it was hilly, but once you figure out trolley you can get off by the Fairmont and walk downhill instead of walking up hill from China Town or Union Station. Breakfast was filling. Juice, milk, cereal, muffins, fruit, toast, we took trays to our room and spread out while we planned the day, and staff cleaned up after us! And the best coffee! We took the "classic cable car sighseeing" tour. So much fun, just wish we had done that the first day to see what was out there. Would have skipped the trip to Saualito (pricey art and not much else) and spent time at Crissy Field at the Presidio, Candlestick park, or Goldengate park. Next time Nappa valley, and Yoesemitte

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the location”
Reviews.Author: natly90
Reviews.Content: Great location- a few blocks from Chinatown and Union Square and it's right in Nob Hill. The rooms were alright- very spacious but not luxurious. The price was great for the location. Staff was friendly. The breakfast wasn't great. Just muffins, bagels and sugary cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,”
Reviews.Author: Tolly76
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at this hotel in a 1 bed Corner King suite (Room 1705) with my wife from September 15th 2010. As there was a conference in town, all hotels in SF had inflated prices so I booked this hotel purely with my budget in mind. The 20% tripadvisor discount was accepted without fuss at check-in and my bill reflected the revised room rate. As others have stated, the hotel is on top of Nob Hill and despite considering myself of a reasonable fitness the walk up from Union Square after a night of eating and drinking can be a challenge. That said, the walk does at least help burn a few calories..... The hotel itself was fine. Previous stops on our trip had included Planet Hollywood in Las Vegas and a Hyatt so we knew this would be a step down in luxury. We were not too disappointed however as the size of the room and the views made up for the older (in some places a little shabby) appearance. Everything was very clean though. No air con, but there was a fan in one of the cupboards as well as a safe and an ironing board. The self service launderette in the basement was handy for us, and cheap at approx $1.50 per wash. We checked out the breakfast room on the first morning but nothing looked too appetising to us so we got a coffee to go and never went back. It always looked pretty busy when we passed on subsequent days though so perhaps we were just a little picky. The Hotel parking was convenient with direct access from Pine Street. It is a little pricey at $35 a day but that seems to be the norm for SF. It was easy to get in and out and although the car park is small I never had difficulty getting a space. Driving around SF is a unique experience with the hills, fog, cable cars and one way systems but Iâ€™m glad I had a car to do some exploring outside of the city. We hired bikes from Blazing Saddles just a few blocks away (down the hill) on Mason and cycled across the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito, and then on to Tiburon which I would recommend. The hotel had a 'Bay Area Guide' magazine with a $5 discount for this. I would consider this hotel if going back to SF, but only if the higher class hotels are out of my price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, rusty place”
Reviews.Author: marloth2000
Reviews.Content: Very rusty place with an extremely friendly staff 24/7. We had an enormous room with a great view to SF. The small â€œkitchenâ€� is good, when the kids want a little snack or a cold drink. The bathroom is the size of a telephone booth. The included breakfast is acceptable, but the dining room far too small. Get there early or eat at your room. Walking distance to financial center, the peers etc.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient? Maybe!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyMar
Reviews.Content: Even if it calls itself a luxury accommodation in San Francisco Iâ€™d be careful to consider it that way. It is a good accommodation but far from a luxury one. A 20 story building not far from the center where many things in the apartment look old. For our four days stay we had a clean and large apartment which could accommodate four people in two comfortable queen size beds. Two large windows with a view on the far bay, a clean bathroom and a small kitchen. Unfortunately the kitchen was very poorly equipped: just the basic utensils. They may not expect people eating in the apartment. If you think to eat there or want to stay more than few days, check your necessities and ask or what your kitchen lacks (we had two chairs for four people). The apartment had plenty of room for storing the baggage, in room wifi and complimentary breakfast. For the breakfast this accommodation is not a luxury one. The breakfast room is too small being a one room apartment now adapted to breakfast room. Be ready not to find seats if you arrive when the four tables (yes, just four) are occupied. The choice is not large and not completely self service. You must ask for bagels and muffins while you help yourself for cheese, butter, jam and drinks. As you see breakfast without pancakes, eggs and bacon. Anyway if you accept its limits and check carefully if its prices are good Grosvenor could be a convenient choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: KevinW1961
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Grosvenor Suites. For the price (we paid $139 inc taxes) you cant beat the location. Great area in Nob Hill and a short walk down the hill to Chinatown and downtown shopping. We felt very safe to walk around this area anytime. The room was spacious and easily sleeps 5. In our room we had 2 queens and a sofa bed. Small kitchen area and decent continental breakfast included. The room was clean, bright and quiet with a good view of downtown (we were on the 5th floor) The parking is expensive just like most of the hotels in San Francisco. The staff are all very polite and helpful. I would especially recommend for families who need the extra space.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: GH53821
Reviews.Content: Our stay was based on Tripadvisor reviews and I am very happy with the overall service of staff and the amenities of the hotel. It was clean, comfortable and well equipped with a decent sized bed, sofa, TV, free WIFI, small kitchen with fridge which was great. You could pick on things if you had to where suitcases had bumped and scraped here and there or decor a bit tired but it really isn't worth the effort. My wife looks at bath, toilet & general cleanliness as soon as we're in the door and she was quite happy. Location was great, Mason/Powell trolley stop on corner of block. We walked to Fishermans Wharf and back several times during our stay in about 20 minutes or so. Same with Union square but when you've wined and dined it's only a few blocks to get back, up hill. Breakfast was a bit meagre but it's only to start your day so no complaints there. No tea or coffee supplied in the rooms but there is a corner shop downhill either side to get your bits and bobs. Staff were friendly and helpfull. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value but not for those who want everything new”
Reviews.Author: FUNANDGAMESTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: I know some travelers like the fresh carpets and new towels. This is a relatively inexpensive, good-value hotel that is NOT unclean but is not new in these features. We were fortunate enough to get a 1 bedroom suite on the 17th floor. The view alone was worth it, but we saved over $ 100 for the week - probably more - but walking 5 blocks to the local supermarket and getting food for our meals. We just didn't want to eat out for 7 whole days. The front staff was always incredibly responsive and attentive. The rooms were spacious; there was a hall way, a smallish but sufficient bathroom, a full king bedroom, and a large livingroom with a couch that turned into a bed, an eat-in dining area, and a one-wall kitchen with a shoulder-high refrigerator, microwave, sink and small stove. Great value and, at 3 blocks from Chinatown, Union Square and all kinds of public transportation - a great location! Need to be a bit of a hill-climber! The other thing I want to mention is about the city of San Francisco itself. It has come upon hard times and it shows. The cable car conductors were randomly surly and the bartender at the Buena Vista Cafe was barely civil - both unheard of in times past - and the local Walgreens put $ 6.99 cans of coffee behind glass because of the frequent robberies (the grab-and-run kind). Bring a money belt (no purses for women) and be prepared for a bit of an edge. One of our best experiences was at the Cigar Bar & Grill on Montgomery; open, airy courtyard; great food; my husband enjoyed a wonderful cigar in the deep leather chairs. And not too expensive. Final note for East Coasters - nothing special about the In-and-Out Burger - don't understand that hype!

Reviews.Title: “The Grosvenor is gross”
Reviews.Author: musicmafia
